conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and information from graph
Graph shows a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram for an ideal gas
Use ideal gas law PV = nRT
Given temperature at state A is 300 K, find temperature at state C
State A: P_A = 4 atm, V_A = 10 L
State B: P_B = 4 atm, V_B = 20 L
State C: P_C = 2 atm, V_C = 40 L
Use ideal gas law for state A: 4 x 10 = nR x 300
Use ideal gas law for state C: 2 x 40 = nR x T_C
Relate equations from states A and C: 40/300 = 80/T_C
Final answer: Temperature of gas in state C is 600 K
